Reviews.Title: “Family owned property that treat you like family”
Reviews.Author: Judy1002
Reviews.Content: We have visited the Alimandi 3 times on our trips to Italy and each time we felt welcomed and at home. Twice we brought family and friends and once was just my husband and myself. The rooms were clean and air-conditioned and the owners and staff were always accomodating.Their rooftop breakfasts were top notch. I especially liked being steps from the Vatican Museum. I highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean, and perfect for group of friends or families traveling together.”
Reviews.Author: intl806
Reviews.Content: Great service received from the staff, felt very welcoming. Clean. Property has several common areas for gathering and "hanging out" together--tv room, pool table room, piano room, rooftop lounge, etc.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, comfortable and friendly hotel in a perfect spot !!”
Reviews.Author: mikkiduf
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alimandi Tunisi is a great value in a prime location ! The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and air conditioned and the hotel is just steps away from the Vatican Museum entrance and St Peter's Square. Breakfast is included in the price and the dining area is at the top of the building in a lovely atrium area with views of the Vatican !! You can easily hop on the metro to visit the other Roman sites. A fantastic value and excellent accomodations !!! I would definitely stay there again !! Charming and comfortable !!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience and great location”
Reviews.Author: speranza7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alimandi via Tunisi was ideal for our first trip to Italy. It offered outstanding value, service, cleanliness, accommodations and hospitality. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. They made us feel like old friends. Hotel Alimandi via Tunisi is located very close to the Vatican, transportation, shops, and restaurants. We walked to St. Peter's Square everyday, sometimes, several times a day. Our room was cozy for a triple, but met all of our needs and was very quiet. The complimentary internet was down, for most of the week, but Mr. Alimandi used the main computer to book a driver for our day trip to Assisi. The delicious breakfast buffet was served in the sunroom on the rooftop and had a variety of hot and cold foods. It was much more than pastries and coffee. Chef Francesco even prepared our breakfast early, on our day of departure. He was delightful! The hotel has a lovely collection of art, made by an Alimandi family member, for the guests to enjoy. We wish that we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyHansen
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, which is at the foot of the Vatican Museum steps in a quiet area of Rome. It is so easy to walk to the Vatican and the rest of Rome is a short metro or taxi ride away. The best part of the hotel is the great breakfast on the rooftop where ever-smiling Francesco welcomes you to start your day with the food he is so proud of. The staff advice for the area is always objective--no kick backs leading you to tourist traps. I keep coming back every time I'm in Rome. It just feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money, tremendous location - Detailed Information on the hotel -”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alimandi Tunisi is, I believe one of the accommodation gems within Rome. It's harsh to call it a 3 star hotel, when it offers service, cleanliness and overall hospitality that far surpasses other 4 star hotels I have visited before. As other reviews indicate, the staff there are very friendly, courteous and helpful. My family were welcomed warmly and settled very quickly, and this hospitality I think should be an important consideration in choosing a hotel. This star quality cannot be found in many other hotels, I can assure you. I was only provided with breakfast from the hotel, so had to find other restaurants and take-aways for the other two meals of the day. Although, I must mention the breakfast was buffet, so I was all too happy to indulge myself in the large variety available. You sit on a large balcony, which was refreshing on an early morning. The room is spacious and the beds are comfortable. The walls are nicely decorated by paintings actually crafted by members of the Alimandi family. The bathroom is has a very ingenious double shower in which the cleanliness is maintained daily. In the lounge on the ground floor, there is satellite TV (which provided us entertainment on our last day before we left) but each room has its own standard italian freeview television(the best channel on this is Eurosport which is in English :D ). The windows have good sound-proofing so sleep quality is excellent. This helped us to be ready for our long walking adventures around Rome in the morning. There are many things to do within the hotel too. It has its own Wi-fi connection, which used to be at expense but is now free of charge. There is an Internet room on the bottom floor, but the Internet can be accessed from anywhere around the hotel. I used my Ipod in the hotel to research the places I wanted to visit, how to get there and their costs. To add, their is a pool table and a gymnasium full of equipment. (I didn't really use it much myself :S ). Finally, there is a grand piano. The hotel itself is very ornately decorated with Roman sculptures, paintings and more. Finally, there are very detailed maps available at the front desk to help you with your exploration of this great city. The location of this hotel was absolutely sublime. It's practically on the border with Vatican City, which is an immense tourist destination for those in Rome. The Vatican Museums including the well-known Sistene Chapel is simply up a flight of stairs, then across the street. You can even see the museum from the breakfast balcony on the 4th floor. Also, the famous St. Peter's Basilica is five minutes down a few wide easily traversable roads, along the border of Vatican City, which we visited quite a few times during our trip. To be right next to these is a great advantage because (if you wake up early) you can queue up to enter them and beat many of the other tourists to those destinations, particularly because queues get quite long, even in the late morning and afternoon. The Metroline was very helpful facility on our trip to various different places of interest. This hotel is quite close to the prime station "Ottaviano", which is around 500 metres away or a 6 to 7 minute walk. From there you can visit a multitude of various places, some which I will list here now: - The Spanish Steps - "Spagna" - The Trevi Fountain & The Pantheon - "Barberini" - Colloseum and Circus Maximus - "Colloseo" or "Circo Massimo" - Saint John Lateran Church - "San Giovanni" The Metro is very cheap and easy to use. We found ourselves using it a lot because we wanted to get the most out of our trip by travelling to as many sites as possible. For me, I also enjoyed how cool it was inside, out of the harshness of mid 30's temperatures. There are a vast array of shops in the hotel's vicinity. The area is littered with souvenir shops because the hotel is so close to these tourist destinations. In the back streets around our hotel, there are many restaurants to go to. I mostly had pizzas my time there. An important tip to remember is that the longer the queue for these restaurants/take-aways, the better the quality of the food, so it's better to queue up for these ones. On one corner, there is an ice-cream shop called "Old Bridge" which has monstrous queues, but is reportedly one of the best ice-cream shops in the world, well worth going to. Therefore, it leaves me to report that this is a great hotel, undeserving of a lowly 3 stars quality, but because it is so, it provides amazing value for money. It's excellent location makes it a no-brainer for global sightseers, Christian pilgrims and Italian tourists alike.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lotois
Reviews.Content: After a disastrous 'B and B' experience on the adjacent via Goletta we managed to get a room for 3 nights at this hotel and were delighted that we were able to stay here.Signor Alimandi and all his staff were simply brilliant...friendly,courteous and ever helpful.The hotel is vary clean,the air conditioned rooms perfect and the breakfasts delicious and catering to all tastes....bacon,eggs,cold meats and cheeses,cereals,yoghurts,pastries,cakes....you name it and it is here and of high quality.Located opposite the steps leading to the Vatican museum entrance and with a few restaurants and a Carrefour practically on the doorstep.Metro and buses are all within a 5-10 minute stroll.This hotel also provides free WiFi and a games and exercise room.Basically it is a terrific,non-corporate hotel with a soul and the icing on the cake is not only the location but also and especially Signor Alimandi and his staff.....can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi Tunisi-friendly staff but nothing like a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchwonder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alimandi Tunisi, not Hotel Alimandi, and only stayed one night moving to another hotel the second night. The room was small and looked like a dorm room. The walls were thin and you could hear water running in the bathroom from other rooms. The quality of the building and furniture seemed very poor and nothing like a 3 star hotel. The staff, however, was excellent and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Whether it is your first or many visits, this hotel makes you really miss Rome”
Reviews.Author: KarenBarone
Reviews.Content: The hotel Alimandi is like a safe and warm haven in the middle of one of the most fascinating cities in the world. Just steps from the Vatican, this is a warm and neighbor driven nieghborhood. Across the street is wonderful gelato, down on the corner, you will find Guilio's with the best lasagne and any other lunch your heart would desire. There are so many wonderful little restaurants, shopping, and even a grocery, pharmacy and tobacco store. It provides a really Roman experience. The hotel itself is spotless. The common areas are warm and comfortable, a piano room, television room a small lovely bar and even a private spot downstairs for you to use the computer..The breakfast is the icing on the cake. What a way to start the day on the terrace of the hotel with Francesco, he takes so much pride in his work. Breakfast is plentiful with a great selection, not to mention the best cappucicino that any of us had in Italy. His smile and care fit right in with this family run affair who will go to any length to make their guest happy and comfortable.Last but not least, when you come in after sightseeing, I love to take a glass of wine up on the terrace and look out and soak in the fact that I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location great- rooms not so...”
Reviews.Author: wilkinson123
Reviews.Content: Great location and very nice public areas in the hotel. The rooms are a bit worn but comfortable. The breakfast is the best we had in Italy by far. Staff is a bit aloof but would help when pushed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations/directly across from the Vatican Entrance”
Reviews.Author: retired060
Reviews.Content: I am from Cleveland, Ohio. Traveled to Rome to see the Vatican on our way to cruise the Med. for a week. This hotel is very clean and staff was very nice. You get a breakfast with your stay which had a large variety of food to choose from. Small cocktail bar in the facility. We enjoyed it very much. Very reasonable on the price also.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dbc12
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a mini break to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Alimandi. Its situated just over the road from the Vatican Museum. We flew with Ryanair from Stansted and once again was surprised at how easy and good this was. We booked the private transfer provided by the hotel for 50 euros. This was quite welcome and very professional. The driver was waiting for us and we were treated to a luxury Mercedes mini bus which was lovely. One tip however is that for the return journey you can get a normal Rome taxi which is just as efficient for 30 euros. On arriving at the hotel we were booked in super quick and assigned our room. We had booked a quad room and when we opened the door (room 305) we were absolutely blown away. The room was amazing, two huge double beds, a massive room, a little corridor leading to a private balcony, and a bathroom with wall to floor marble. Evrything was perfect and very very comfortable. We were really pleasantly surprised and also found that the rate we got of 180 euros per night , incl breakfast was well worth it. Breakfasts were great, really well catered and very tasty with a mix of hot and cold choices. The service of the hotel staff, from reception to room cleaners was excellant. The area around the Vatican is okay, nothing too special but actually we felt it was a good place to stay. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the metro and at 1 euro a journey it was a welcome change from the shafting you find on the underground in London. One tip, on the way to the metro you pass a little pizza rustica shop.....dont be tempted, they shafted us big time !!!!! However, we found Rome very reasonable in terms of food prices and even the cab fares were not extortionate. !!! Most people were very helpful and we felt secure at all times. Tips; We used http://www.romancandletours.com/ and did two tours, vatican and the ancient city tour. They were exceptional and I would highly rec them. Get a normal Rome cab back to the airport, they have a fixed price of 30 euros. Dont be worried about using the Metro, its really quite efficient and secure. We really did have a great trip and the hotel was great, we will def go back there again when we return to Rome which we will most certainly be doing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel93
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for Rome - the staff was very friendly, especially Francesco, and the rooftop terrace with breakfast buffet is fantastic. Two drawbacks: (1) the hotel is near the Vatican but not much else (although it is a 4-5 block walk to the metro which will get you anywhere), and (2) not all rooms are created equal (I traveled with family and out of the 3 rooms we occupied, 2 were great but the last (mine) was tiny, smelled awful and didn't have a working fridge). In addition - check their website to get the best deal - it was cheaper than third party websites - but just be sure to get them to honor the deals that they advertsie on their own website. All in all - a very good value for Rome and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel with a very friendly, accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Vatican09
Reviews.Content: For our first time in Rome, we couldn't have pick a better hotel. No matter what information or accomodation we requested, it was provided expediently with nothing but a friendly smile ready for the next request.. The breakfast was delicious and the hotel was very clean and comfortable. Nico was especially helpful and very accomodating. He went above and beyond to make us feel right at home. I look forward to our next trip to Rome where we will definitely make a reservation to staty at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bosdou
Reviews.Content: i just wanted write a little review on Hotel Alimandi. Nico and his staff were great, very helpfull and attentive to their guest. I was very please with everything from the location, large rooms, wonderful staff and the breakfast buffet. Thank you Nico for a wondferful stay at Hotel Alimandi. I will be staying at the hotel again next time i return to Rome. Steve from Boston

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tes1226
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The front desk was so helpful. The hotel is literally in front of the Vatican. Just cross the street and the entrance to the Sistene chapel is right there. It takes about 8 minutes to walk to the entrance to get to St. Peter's square. There is a bus stop just around the corner. There is a grocery store a block away. Wonderful restaurants everywhere. Breakfast was included and plentiful. Rooms were big and beautiful. I couldn't have asked for a better hotel. We absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “We miss Francesco!!”
Reviews.Author: joepugusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Rome and we will be going back again....and again. The staff was helpful and shuttle to and from the airport was great. But the highlight of the stay I must say was definitely Francesco their chef. Every morning we were greeted with a huge smile, delicious hot breakfast and pastries. Next time we will book 2 rooms; one for our adult children who stayed their with us. The Puglise Family, Texas

Reviews.Title: “A Value Near The Vatican”
Reviews.Author: the_faceman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alimandi for about a week and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is just a stone's throw (up some stairs) to the Vatican Museum. Getting in to The Vatican itself (like to St. Peter's Square), is a good 5 blocks awau or so along the walls of the Vatican....not really a chore. Following Rick Steve's recommendation, we took a lot of cabs. We found that we could get just about anywhere in Rome from Hotel Alimandi for about 10-12 Euros. The Metro is about 3 or 4 blocks away and will get you around easily, too. We have to give a shout out to Francesco, the gregarious breakfast cook and server. He is an adorable character and was a bright start to each day that we were in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, comfortable, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: akleigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alimandi for almost a week and from our arrival felt comfortable and welcome. We were delighted with the size of both our room and bathroom - and with the power shower! Breakfast was generous, varied and relaxed. Service was especially friendly and there was no limit to the cappuccinos! All staff were approachable, attentive and responsive, and everyone was willing to help with even the smallest request. It is clear that this is a family-run hotel, and there were personal touches at every turn; it was lovely to arrive at a restaurant recommended by Grazia and to be welcomed because they had been told to expect us. We look forward to a return visit, and would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Alimandi at Via Tunisi to even our most exacting friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klward25
Reviews.Content: Most recently I stayed at this hotel in August 2008, but I also stayed there during a previous trip to Rome in 2005. The hotel was a nice as I remebered. The rooms are very large for Europe and they are one of the few hotels with actual quad rooms, meaning two double/queen beds. Most hotels simply roll cots into a double room. Another great feature is the breakfast, which has a large variety of both cold and hot food. Finally, the location, which is directly accross from the entrance to the Vatican Museum cannot be beat. The next time I am in Rome , I will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: comingtoyourcity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the via Tunisi street hotel and had a wonderful experience. You might think the hotel is out of the way near the Vatican but the bus system in Rome is so convenient and the front desk is very helpful finding the right bus to get you where you want to go. The rooms were a good size with a great air conditioner! They were very quiet too (we were in room 235). The shower was a little small though. The hotel has a great community room with a TV and we all enjoyed watching the European football championship games together. The breakfast was on the roof, which was so nice. Good food too! It was also nice having a shuttle to the airport and from the train station when we arrived!

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel Alimandi”
Reviews.Author: Hungaria
Reviews.Content: This hotel was far beyond our expectations. We have many fond memories of our time there. The personnel were friendly, courteous and respectful . They could not have done more for us to make our time there more enjoyable. We have recommended this hotel to family and friends. Stay and have a great time !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Location Service & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ALFREDUCCIO
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Alimandi since 1966. I might be prejudice but I still marvel at the wonderful job they have done and continue to do with thier hotels. Alimandi Vaticano is a wonderful hotel with large ,clean and beautiful rooms, great service especially Aldo at the front desk. Great food, and here I'm an expert since I have been a chef for some 35 years. In fact, Pino, the chef at Vaticano does a marvelous job in preparing the buffet breakfast which includes eggs and bacon done crispy by the way. The house keeping is under the perview of Sandra Alimandi who keeps a constant overview of the hotel and it's needs. The Alimandi family tradition was started my their mother, Dina, in the mid 50's by renting out rooms in her apartment. The children have worked hard in building up the two hotels and have mantained the mother's tradition of cleanliness and hospitality. I will be returning to Rome in Sept and they will have my room ready.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Nothing better in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: albiceleste33
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at throughout all our travels. It was the people who owned the hotel that made it all the more amazing-- the Alimandi family, especially Grazia. Grazia helped us tremendously every night on where to go, what to do, tips to get into the Vatican when the line is shorter, and places to eat. The amenities in the hotel were great. Everything was very clean, the bathroom was always stocked, the rooms were quiet, and the price was good for Italy. Book directly with the hotel b/c it's usually less and if you pay in cash it's a 5% discount. Staying at this family hotel beats staying at a huge hotel because of the interactions we had. We even celebrated New Year's Eve with the Alimandi family! We highly recommend the Alimandi hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Alimandi Tunisi”
Reviews.Author: rose2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi Tunisi (1 block from the Vatican Musuem) for 5 nights before touring Italy to return again for another night. Staff was friendly, professional and spoke English. Breakfast is served in a lovely sun room on the roof from which you can see the Vatican walls. Breakfast had a nice selection. Rooms are perfectly adequate. Near the metro to get you over to the center of Rome in about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: normandMontreal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed four nights April 6th to 10 at the Alimandi via Tunisi (the three star hotel).The hotel is on a relatively quiet street ( less busy than the 4 star Alimandi wich cost a lot more) The room was clean and confortable,location is great ,the staff is helpful,the breakfast chef Francesco is great and his cappucino is one of the best in Rome.There is a very good restaurant nearby named l'Angoletto ai Musei (Via Leone),great pastas and veal good prices.Complimentary shuttle to the airport was very appreciated since the cost of taxis is exorbitants in Rome.Overall this little hotel is one of the best value in Rome and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Piano”
Reviews.Author: alongtheroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by Rick Steves. It was a perfect location for us since we spent two of our three days in Rome at the Vatican. This is right across the street. We had three young adult children with us and they put us in a double and triple room right across the hall from each other. Our oldest son would have been in withdrawal without a piano to play for three weeks in Italy, so having one for the guests to use in the lobby was perfect! Friendly staff too. Francesco made absolutely wonderful breakfasts for the guests each morning in the rooftop dining area. Close to Vatican, shopping, and still within a nice walking distance to the Piazza Navona area for the night walk and a short bus ride to funky Trastevere. Easy metro ride to colosseum. The only small complaint was the shower drains seemed to be sluggish, but that wouldn't stop me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Breakfast to die for! Terrace overlooking The Vatican Museum”
Reviews.Author: Jerseynurs
Reviews.Content: My family stayed @ Hotel Alimandi August 2007. We were most pleased with their hospitality and outstanding service. They are always there for you to help out with tips on what's best time to visit tourist places, directions to places, making reservations etc. It was an incredible-unforgettable experience to had dined in their terrace facing the Vatican Museum!! Their daily breakfast was outstanding- This is a home away from home - Thanks Aldo and everyone @ the Alimandi for a most pleasant stay-

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay especially if Vatican is top spot to visit”
Reviews.Author: Auntiesandee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right by the Vatican Museum and a five minute walk to Vatican. The people at the hotel speak English and will give you a map to get around Rome. This hotel is near the Vatican and about a 20-30 minute walk to some of the other Major sites such as Trevi Foutain, Pantheon, etc. You eat breakfast on the rooftop and breakfast is made every morning by Francesco. The food and the deserts are good. Just make sure you get there early. Once it is gone that's it. Also we went up to the rooftop in the evenings and met some great people staying at the hotel. We learned of great places to eat around the hotel from these people. We had a large room, only two of us, with a queen bed and two twins. The bathroom was very large. The room was always clean. This hotel is the three star hotel. They also own a four star hotel near by which is posted on Trip Advisor. Make sure you go to Alberto's. Just ask the people at the desk. Alberto's just looks like a small pizzeria from the outside but the food is great. I suggest trying his Gnocchi. You can have it with all different types of sauces. Alberto also speaks English. There is public transportation near by. Just make sure if you buy a bus ticket when you get a bus put your ticket in the machine on the bus. We did not and the bus Gastapo, and you do not know when they will get on the bus, made us get off the bus. We did only get a scolding and fortunately they left us off at a major bus stop so we could still get to our destination. Also make sure you ask how to say bus ticket in Italian. Some places are not so nice if you don't speak the language. There was a place close by the hotel that wasn't very nice where we bought the tickets. Another point Italians say everything is one left or right and then straight the rest of the way. This is kind of true. Stay mostly to the main roads and you will get to your destination. There are signs to a lot of the sites on the main roads in english. I will stay at this hotel again when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “5 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Malb59
Reviews.Content: the Hotel was very nice and clean the staff were very helpful and cheerful always a smile The only moan was that they didnt do evening meals.Eating out every night cost a fortune and wasnt that good

Reviews.Title: “Great location/excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Ted_E_Beare
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay in the Alimandi and would highly recommend it for the following reasons: 1. staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The lovely Dunia and Paoula Alimandi deserve special mention for their charming and helpful manner during our stay. 2. location just 3 minutes from the entrance to the Vatican Museum/about 8 minutes from St. Peter's Sq./7 minutes to nearest metro station. Historic Rome is easily accessible by public transport or on foot (in cooler weather!) 3. Breakfast is excellent, served on the terrace by the ever attentive Francesco (assisted by his son Stefano during our visit) what a great way to start the day! 4. Spotless, if basic, rooms were well serviced during our stay and there are lovely public rooms to chill out in away from the noise, heat and bustle of Rome. 5. The complimentary shuttle is an excellent service if your flight coincides with its departure times to/from the Airport. Overall this is an excellent hotel and can be highly recommened. Kind regards from two satisfied visitors from Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Value by the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: capri30
Reviews.Content: You cannot get much closer to the Vatican Museum entrance. And it's an easy walk to rest of the Vatican attractions. It also satisfied our family of four with a queen bed and two singles. This was hard to find in Rome. Everything was clean and worked. All the amenities of a 4 start hotel were there. Breakfast was great and down right amazing when you consider it’s included. The staff was courteous and very eager to please. The hotel had several small public rooms with TV, a pool table, a small bar and lots of books. The owners also have a 4 star hotel and their experience spills over into this lower priced property. Also included was transportation to the airport for all of us. Carnival cruises wanted 230 Euros for a ride to the airport. At Hotel Alimandi the four of us got a room, breakfast and a ride to the airport for 220 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Beware there are tow alimandi Hotels”
Reviews.Author: sallyglebe
Reviews.Content: Be aware that there are Two Alimandi Hotels just across the road from each other. We thought we had booked through Rooms. accommodationfor the 4 star but ended up at the 3 star. Then we didn't even stay at the hotel but at some dire appartments acorss the road. Lift like some out of a 1940's movie (wire cage) and saniflow toilet down the corridor. Breakfast was awful - looked like left over veg from the night before with gushing waiter. Couldn't wait to check out. They charged 130 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel to Rome rather frequently, and found this to be the most comfortable hotel in its class that I've stayed at in the city. We had moved over to this hotel after a negative experience at another hotel in Rome, and the Hotel Alimandi more than made up for it. The staff are friendly and helpful, if also very quick to assume you don't speak Italian! The rooms are very comfortable and quiet. The location is ideal for Vatican-related touring, but is also very close to the Ottaviano Metro station, so there is easy access to much of the city. There's a billiard table to shoot some pool, plus a single computer downstairs to send quick emails from. If walking around the city isn't enough exercise for you, there is a small exercise room with some weight machines and a couple free weights plus a couple different cardio machines, complete with a view of the Roman remains under the building, visible through the plexiglass flooring! The rooftop terrace is a lovely spot for breakfast in the morning. And the breakfast buffet is really quite generous, with not only the usual breads, jams, cheeses, yogurts, but also some cooked items as well, (bacon, sausage, eggs, potatoes).

Reviews.Title: “Alimandi Staff Is Great!”
Reviews.Author: EFCTexas
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had the great pleasure of lodging at this wonderful hotel. The Vatican is one block away, the entrance to the Vatican Museum is a block away. Access to the rest of Rome was accomplished via subway and the best way to see Rome, by foot! The room was comfortable and after a busy day in Rome, the bed was heaven! The staff was exceptional. Francesco made breakfast a special event every morning. There's a small bar right behind the hotel, it's great too! We hope to visit Rome in a couple of years, and Alimandi will be our place to reflect on this wonderful and exciting city! Cantu Family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Alimandi”
Reviews.Author: bbg
Reviews.Content: We had a excellent stay at the Hotel. The location is very good, right next to the Vatican and at the same time other attractions are just a subway or a bus ride away. Public transportation was inexpensive and easy to navigate. Paulo was always ready to answer any questions that we had whether it was about the best time to see the Vatican or what bus would take us to the Colosseum. The entire staff was very nice and extremely helpful. We stayed in quadruple room which we found to be very comfortable. Breakfast with Francesco was always fun and delicious. On the way in we requested the shuttle pickup and on the way back we took a cab to the airport since it was in the evening. We had a great time in Rome and the hotel and its staff made this possible every step of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi ***--Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: jschrage
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay!! Our stay at Hotel Alimandi (Three Star) was just perfect! We planned a 10 day trip to Italy (4 in Rome) and the days at Hotel Alimandi were great. I traveled with my three sons, and it was ideal for all of us!! We booked a quadruple room, but the Alimandis gave us 2 double rooms instead (very nice). We found the hotel on Trip Advisor, and all of the reviews are accurate! Breakfast every morning with Francesco (the chef) was great. There was an outside patio which was beautiful, and the breakfast was delicious (he made me cappucino every morning). Some advice, however: don't get to breakfast too late, there are some things (like the bacon) that don't get replenished. The location is perfect too!! The Vatican Museum is basically right across the street, and St. Peter's Basilica isn't more than a 5-10 minute walk away. There was a Metro station nearby, and although it is a bit of a walk to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps (we took the Metro), it is a great location right in the center of town. Also, the entire Alimandi staff and family were very kind and helpful, and could all speak English. Another great thing about the hotel was its cleanliness. If we ever make it back to Rome, we would stay at Hotel Alimandi in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “superb stay at alimandi vaticano”
Reviews.Author: stringyted
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel. it was superbly located overlooking the vatican museum entrance, and was staffed with kind and helpful people. the room we had was two double beds, with lots of space for 4, and the bathroom was deliciously fitted out in a brand new suite, with lots of lovely toiletries. the bar was a lovely spot for an after dinner nightcap, and we enjoyed the breakfast treats of cakes and pastries and cheese and meats. it's true the restaurants are disappointing nearby, but trastevere is a cheap £5 taxi ride away. we'd definately come here again. we were a party of 2 adults with 2 children aged 12 and 10.

Reviews.Title: “So close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Princess T-Rex
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Rome to see all you can of the Vatican, this is the hotel for you! You are literally one street away from the enterance to the Vatican Museums (which are really great). We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Alimandi. Francesco, the breakfast chef, was very friendly and the food was good. Breakfast here was more of a fry up (eggs - fried or scrambled or hard boiled, fried potatos, toast, pastries, little sausages, bacon, fried veggies, tea, and cappuccino). Francesco makes you cappucino as soon as you walk into the breakfast room (which is an amazing solarum overlooking part of Rome). Our room was small but clean and the only place on our two week trip that had a television (only one channel in English). We went to Rome to see the sights but we were most interested in being close to the Vatican. If you don't have a strong interest in the Vatican (St. Peter's, Castle San Angelo, Audience with the Pope, Vatican Gardens, Vatican Museums, etc.) this isn't the hotel for you, as it is not close to much else. Still, there was a nearby Metro stop and we were able to get around easily enough. The staff at the Hotel Alimandi is pleasant. The bonus of this hotel is the free shuttle to and from the airport which just made our lives so much simpler.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi - Good”
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and her husband stayed at this hotel in July and it was great and in a very good position, the staff were very friendly and made you feel at home. The only complaint I had was that unless you were up at the crack of dawn for breakfast there was nothing left as supplies were not replenished at all.

Reviews.Title: “The best place”
Reviews.Author: mbelove
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 weeks in Italy. The Hotel Alimandi was the best hotel we stayed at. The rooms were large, the breakfast was the best anywhere. They had internet service in the hotel. They helped with any tours we wanted. The staff was friendly and spoke english. When I go back this is the place for me. Maida Belove

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: FCDC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a 5-night stay in the Hotel Alimandi on Via Tunisi, just a block away from the Vatican entrance in early June 2006. We very much enjoyed our stay. The hotel (not to be confused with the slightly upmarket 'other' Hotel Alimandi just up the street and around the corner) is a family owned (the owner being born on-site) and operated business. The service was very good, with English not a problem. We were able to do walking trips each day to visit all of the usual tourist spots, taking the bus just once on the way in to town, so the location is very good. The basic room was a decent size but the bathroom was tiny. The tub made having a shower an unusual experience. The Queen bed was actually two single beds pushed together. These had a tendency to 'travel" over the course of the night. The roof-top restaurant (for the included breakfast) was a very nice treat. "Francesco" makes all of the pastries daily himself and takes great pride in doing so. He is however, a bit of a shameless tip-hound. The staff were very accomodating however, opening the resaurant early on our last day so that we could have a bite before heading out. There are decent and innexpensive restaurants nearby, and a laundry business also. I would stay at the Hotel Alimandi again. There were no reaql surprizes and nothing bad happened to spoil our stay. The prices are reasonable also.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Coynets
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located at via Tunisi 8, is very close to the Vatican, which is probably its biggest asset. The room we stayed in was small but comfortable, located on the first floor. The bathroom was clean, but also somewhat small. There was a fair bit of traffic outside the room that created some noise during the day, but it was fairly quiet during sleeping hours. The the hotel staff spoke passable English and was quite helpful. The hotel has a vary nice terrace on the 4th floor where breakfast is served and which has a nice view of the city. The breakfast chef, Francesco, was very friendly and proud of his work. We paid 160 euros a night (tax included) for our double room in late May (high season). Overall, I would recommend staying at this hotel, especially if you are looking for a place within easy walking distance of the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable hotel experience ever because of the staff!”
Reviews.Author: porpora
Reviews.Content: With many decades of hotel experiences behind me, I can still confidently say that my stay at the Hotel Alimandi was the most memorable of my life! Now it's true that Hotel Alimandi's beds are comfortable; the rooms and bathrooms immaculately kept up; the prices exceptionally reasonable (I paid 90 Euros for a single at the peak of tourist season); the air conditioning pleasant and reliable; and the internet service convenient as there is a computer available downstairs. It's also true that the roof garden is a delightful oasis where you can start your day with hearty breakfasts (though I was too excited about Rome to actually have an appetite in the morning). And it's true that the hotel's location -- just across from the Vatican -- is lovely and close to the bus and metro lines. But that's not why I'll remember this hotel so fondly. The real magic of this place is supplied by the family that runs it. I came to Italy in substantial part to meet Italians, to glimpse a bit of their vaunted warmth and hospitality, and that's exactly what I got at the Alimandi the minute I walked into the hotel. From the warm smiles of Federica and Dunia ... to Salvio's thoughtful ruminations about Italian culture ... to Graziella's warmth, wisdom and wit ... to chef Francesco's ebullience and generosity -- this hotel is all heart. One warning however: if you ever happen to find yourself on the roof garden during a championship World Cup Soccer match with Italy poised to win, as I did: DON'T sit in front of Francesco. The man is a menace with a blowhorn ... nearly fell off my seat three times! No, seriously, I had the time of my life watching the game with staff and Italian friends and afterwards, the hotel broke out the Spumanti for everyone. It goes without saying that I hope to return to Rome again and again and that I'll never stay anywhere else but the Alimandi. A couple of tips: thanks to Federica's recommendation, I had several memorable meals at a charming family-run restaurant just a block away from the hotel: the Piacere Molise. (Molise is a small region in central Italy). Counterintuitive as it may sound to an American, try the fish-stuffed ravioli: it's fresh and homemade, as are all the dishes, and astonishingly good. Also, if you're interested in bringing back some beautiful etchings of Rome at very affordable prices, I wholeheartedly recommend Casali's at 81 Piazza della Rotonda just next to the Pantheon, just a short bus ride from the hotel. Be sure to say hi to owner Claudio Casali for me. One minor suggestion: I hope ALL the staff -- yes that means you too, Graziella and Salvio -- will post their photos here at tripadvisor. We guests might not think to take pictures of you at the time, but we sure will treasure them afterwards. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “great rooftop terrace breakfast at the Hotel Alimandi”
Reviews.Author: olette49
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed in a triple room at the 3 star Hotel Alimandi on Via Tunisi in Rome for 4 nights in June, 2006. Our room was very comfortable, with lots of attractive wooden shelving and storage space. The a/c worked very well which we appreciated as it was very hot during our visit. The rooftop terrace is a delight, both to enjoy the outdoors as well as to visit with other guests, many of whom were Americans and reading Rick Steve's Italy or Rome guide as we were. The chef, Francesca, creates a lovely buffet each morning and serves up cappucino with gusto and a smile. If you return the smile and try out a little Italian, you may even get serenaded. My only gripe (but one for which I was prepared by reading previous TripAdviser posts) was that the breakfast buffet does not get sufficiently replenished, so that if you have the misfortune to be a guest while other large groups are in the hotel and they hit the buffet as early as 7:00 (although the posted start is 7:30), it may be cleaned out of many items by 8:00. So just be sure to be there early and you won't be disappointed. We used cabs quite alot in Rome as the Alimandi is near the Vatican, but we also did walk over to the Spanish steps area, so it's doable on foot. By our last day we had figured out the buses and trains (simple really), so that helped compensate for this not so central location.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent in Alimandi 4 wonderful days. Thanks to all previos comments and to your advises, because all was just excelent. Good hotels position, new rooms, very well furnished, wonderful tasty breakfast. Roma is my favorite city, so I think we will not even try to search something more for next Romas visiting. Alimandi is perfect!:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is friendly and helpful, the accomodations exceed expectations, the location perfect. If you are travelling to Rome and looking for the best place to stay, choose Alimandi!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town”
Reviews.Author: armypilot
Reviews.Content: Contacted the Alimandi Hotel in Rome about 8 months before travel. There are two Alimandi Hotels with same ownership but the one across the street from the Vatican Museum is the four star and around the corner is the three star. We stayed in the four star. Folks there are extremely helpful, couteous, and responsive !! They arranged for a Vatican Museum tour with an English speaking guide. This hekped us avoid the 4 block long line of general public visitors. Walked right in ahead of everybody. The hotel staff arranged a dinner for the 12 of us at Hostarie L'Orso. Best meal in all of Italy ! The hotel rooms are clean and very well decorated. Small by American standards but large by European standards. Breakfast buffet was nice. Hotel made arrangements for 12 of us to get to the port at Civitevecchia to catch the cruise ship and met us when we returned and took us to the airport. Can't say enough about this hotel and the fine folks who operate it. They even offered to prepare us a meal when we checked in at 3 PM even though they only offer breakfast daily. Extremely customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Of our 4 visits to Rome, this hotel has been the best!”
Reviews.Author: trumore
Reviews.Content: My pastor, my wife, and I just returned from our 4th visit (8 days) to Rome. This was our first stay at the 4 star Alimandi Hotel Vaticano directly across the street from the Vatican museum, and it won't be my last. What a wonderful delightful hotel! All of the furnishings are exquisite, and the rooms were large and spacious. They provide each room with a large variety of toiletries and robe and slippers. The king size bed was very comfortable (with extra pillows), and with a beautiful self service bar in the room. The prices for the bar were most reasonable. A flat screen televison, and of course central air-conditioning was standard. The closet is large and comes with a safe. The bathroom is very large, modern and has plenty of towels and hairdryer. But more important than the furnishings is the family atmosphere that pervades the entire staff. We were made to feel as family during our stay, and the owners gave their special touches to make you feel so welcomed. If we needed information or recommendations, they were so glad to help! Their free pick-up and delivery to the Rome airport is quite a savings. The breakfast each morning was superb, and my wife commented that it was the best breakfast in Rome! So many varieties of food. There is internet access downstairs and even an ironing board for pressing your clothes. It's centrally located in a great residential neighborhood with a nearby grocery store and fruit market, and it's easy to walk the streets at night feeling very secure. The smiling staff was a joy to be around. Even the lobby made you feel welcomed. As far as we are concerned, I have found my home away from home with the Alimandi Vaticano family!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, modern, clean. Very comfortable, great breakfast. Perfect location. It feels like home. No doubt I would stay here again when in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Nothing left to say”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the good things you have been reading about this hotel are true! It's not six star luxury, but for those of us who are still concerned with college tuition or retirement funding, it's a great place and a very fine value. So, what are you waiting for? Go book this hotel before someone else does!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripadvisorUser
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the Vatican - literally, 100 feet from the entrance to the Vatican Museums. The breakfast is very nice, the breakfast staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and modern, and the location is convenient to all of Rome. The front desk staff is slightly clueless, but all in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect, just a block from the Vatican. I'd recommend it to anyone travelling to Rome. Our room was really nice, clean, big enough for the 2 of us and well supplied with accessories. There is a lovely roof top restaurant that served a really nice breakfast (by a bubbly chef!). The people running the hotel were extremely helpful, starting from when we arrived as our safe didn't work, and they replaced it immediately. When we go back to Rome in the future we'll go back to this hotel. TM&KR

Reviews.Title: “Total Fiasco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked 6 months in advance as I have stayed here before. When my family and I arrived I was told the hotel was full. A tour bus had come in with extra people so they gave away my room. He told me he had a solution and took me across the street to an apartment and told me we could stay there. Great except that his brother emerged in a bath robe and we were told he would be there during our visit. We walked the neighborhood and wound up at the Spring House. Never again! Only in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This lovely little hotel, just a block from the Vatican, was every bit as good as all the reviews I looked at said it was. The room was really nice, bath was little small for a guy 6 foot five but it was my only complaint and at that it was a minor annoyance. The lovely roof top restaurant served a really nice breakfast which made the daily cost a real bargain. The folks running the hotel couldn't have been any nicer or more accommodating, nothing asked was too much trouble. When I go back to Rome in the future I have no doubt where we'll stay. By the way, the fire alarm system works, someone smoked in their room and set the alarm system off. While a touch frightening, it was also a comfort knowing that the system worked so well.

Reviews.Title: “A second superb experience”
Reviews.Author: JudeClichy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Alimandi. Rome was the first stop on our 2005 trip to Europe between September and October. Other stays included the Residence La Tavolozza in Positano, the Hotel Bernardi-Semenzato in Venice, and the Mercure Tour Eiffel Suffern in Paris. Also see my reviews of these hotels. This year we stayed at the Alimandi for six nights. Last year, it was 4 nights. Truth be told, as far as I'm concerned, there is no reason to stay at any other hotel in Rome. It will always be our home away from home in Rome. The Alimandi is a family-run hotel with the emphasis on family. The Alimandis are a welcoming, friendly, and happy group of people. The Alimandis have two hotel buildings and our stay was at the original building at #8 via Tunisi. The other Alimandi is at #1, at the top of steps that lead to the Vatican Wall. The Alimandi brothers constantly walk back and forth between their two hotels. Our room was spotless. The sheets fresh and clean, the bathrooms scrubbed, and new towels were placed every day. The front desk staff is helpful and they speak very good English. At any time of the day, there is at least one of the owners present, be it Luigi, Paolo, or Enrico. They are the Alimandi brothers and they all live within seconds of the hotel - as in across the street in apartment buildings. The front desk is staffed with Alimandi relatives - be they nieces or nephews. An added bonus of staying here is the complimentary airport shuttle provided by the hotel. Rides are available until the early afternoon and the driver is - an Alimandi. The breakfast is included in the price of the room. It's served each morning from 7 until 10 in the rooftop garden (both open-air and covered seating). The breakfast is outstanding. Chef Francesco (yes, an Alimandi) serves up a variety of foods including chicken and potatoes, zucchini and mushrooms, and many other hearty dishes. He's constantly making fresh scrambled eggs. There are cereals, pastries, and sliced meats (salami, mortadella, and prosciutto, etc.). There is juice or milk or tea. There is world class coffee - even American-style. There is fruit (prunes, pears, peaches, pineapple). On a diet? There is yogurt. You can make your own toast. There are even power bars and other treats. And of course, there are wonderful pies baked by Chef Francesco himself. He is a hard-working man. Not only does he prepare the food - the rooftop garden seats around 75 or so people - but Francesco greets you and wants to make sure you enjoy your food. Another bonus, a great view of the Vatican and the tip of St. Peter's dome. After hours, you can visit the rooftop for quiet moments - perhaps some late-evening wine or a cigarette for those who smoke. No smoking inside the hotel itself, of course. I should also mention that the Alimandi has a workout room (including a stairmaster), an internet connection station off the workout room, a billiard room, a room with a bar and piano, and a television lounge. All are for the guests. There are also TVs in each room, although why anybody would want to watch television when all of Rome awaits is beyond me. The Hotel Alimandi is in the northside Prati district of Rome and except for the fact that you are down a few steps from the Vatican Wall and the Vatican Museum, it never feels as if you are surrounded by tourists. You actually seem to belong to a neighborhood. There are two Rome Metro Line A (subway) stops within 7 or 8 minutes walking distance from the hotel - the Cipro-Vatican Museum and the Ottaviano-St. Peter. Walk north a block from the hotel on Via Tunisi and turn left on Via Candia, which is a shopping street, to get to the Cipro stop. Turn right on Candia for the Ottaviano-St. Peter stop. There are stores and restaurants of every kind. Via Candia becomes Viale Giulio Cesare (Julius Ceasar Boulevard), which is where the Ottaviano stop is. Remember, in Rome street names change at the drop of a hat. You'll find even more restaurants and shops and a triplex movie theater. Charlie And The Chocolate Factory was one of the offerings there. Across the street from the movie theater on Julius Caesar is the Bella Napoli 2 restaurant. We ate there three of our six nights in Rome, and on a fourth night stopped in around midnight for sorbetto and wine. The Bella Napoli 2 has a great outdoor seating area - Romans generally eat between 8 and midnight - and the food is solid, basic Italian pizza and pasta. Nothing fancy, but good. Waitress Enza and waiter Ben (who speaks English) are as friendly as you'd want anybody to be. Nearby the Alimandi is a fantastic open-air food market on Via Andrea Doria at Tunisi. Simply walk a few blocks north on Tunisi. You can't missed it. There's prosciutto, porcini mushrooms, San Marzano tomatoes, fresh organic brown eggs, astonishing green produce, fresh baked bread, meats and poultry, and much more. It's a genuine treat to see how the Romans live and eat and shop. I also recommend the gelato and granita at the little gelateria across the street from the hotel's entrance. A few blocks down the street from where the hotel entrance fronts (Sebastiano Veniero at Tunisi) is a tiny repertory movie theater. It's on via Scipioni, which is an extension of Seb. Veniero. The theater is called Azzurro Scipioni Cinema and has two small auditoriums - one called Chaplin and the other called Lumiere. Classic Italian and international (American, European) films are shown. The non-Italian movies are usually in the original language. Remember that in Italy, most films are dubbed into Italian. At this cinema, the original language is usually king. Of course, when in Rome you'll visit the usual tourist attractions: St. Peter's, the Coloseum, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, the Roman Forum, Mount Palantine museum, and the Capitoline Museum, etc. The Colosseum lit up at night is a special delight. May I recommend four things you might not consider? And believe me, you should consider them. Three of them are free. The first attraction you might not consider, but should, is a boat ride along the Tiber River. By bus, Metro, or by walking, get to the Tiber. It's about 15-20 minutes from the Alimandi. You'll see steps at most bridges (pontes) leading to the riverwalk. Rome has only just discovered its river views. The Tiber River boat cruise is relatively new. There are small buildings long the walk and inside is where you'll get information. English is spoken. The boats run frequently and journey quite a distance between Ponte Duca D'Aosta and Isola Tiberina (Tiberion Island). We caught our boat near Ponte (bridge) Sant' Angelo (near the old fort). The cost is 1 Euro for each direction. Therefore, if you want to experience the entire cruise, which is incredibly beautiful and pleasant, you'll pay 1 Euro at the start. You're at the halfway point. Then, depending on whether you heading north or south initially, you'll pay another Euro to return. Unless you board at the absolute north or south of the cruise, you really pay a total of 3 Euros for the full cruise. It's less confusing than it sounds and well-worth it. The northern stop is at the Olympic Statium and Olympic grounds with its giant statues in the park near the swimming center. Well-worth walking over to and then coming back to board the return boat. The conductor on the boat collects your money and gives you a ticket. The second attraction is the basilica, St. Paul's Outside The Walls (San Paolo Furi Le Mura). It's a stunning church, massive in size, and breathtaking in beauty. Until St. Peter's was built, this was the largest church in the world, erected over the burial site of St. Paul. The mosaics inside and outside are breathtaking. The columns are astonishing. The exterior and interior courtyards are superb. Take the Rome Metro B line (the blue line) to the Basilica S. Paolo stop. Then exit and walk four minutes to the church. It's open 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. and it's free. The third attraction, and one of the most extraordinary, is a walk along the original Via Appia Antica - the Appian Way. Consider that ancient Romans road their chariots on the paving stones. And those paving stones are the real deal, still making up the narrow road remaining from ancient Rome. Along the early part of the Via Appia Antica - just for a few minutes - are huge estates. Right at the beginning is an Alimentari - a small grocery store - and you can get some snacks, bottled water, wine, meats, breads, etc. to have a picnic on the Appian Way. There are no tour guides. No giant buses. Just a narrow road and fields with flowers and gorgeous trees and ruins. We were astonished to see old tombs and remains of buildings. There were tons of pieces of marble statues, bits of old Rome here and there. It's quiet and peaceful and restive. Those few who come to visit can be spotted sitting relaxed on a marble slab or having a glass of wine and a sandwich. It's not crowded at all. The air is cooler, the sun brighter. You can get there by talking the Rome Metro A line (near the Alimandi) to the Colli Albani subway stop. Exit, and right in front of you will be buses. Take the number 660 bus. The ride to the tiny Appian Way turnaround is about 10 minutes. When you get off the bus, go left. You'll see a large brownish building which houses an apartment and the alimentari I mentioned. Again, get off the bus and go left (south). Stop into the alimentari, get some water or food, say hello to the owner (buon giorno) and enjoy the stroll. You can stroll as far as you want, maybe about an hour's time is best. Go to the first main highway that crosses the Appian Way. Then, if you want, simply turn around, walk back to the Alimentari and catch the 660 bus back to the Colli Albani subway stop and ride back to the Alimandi neighborhood. Another free attraction. The fourth fun attraction is the Porta Portese flea market, which runs on Sundays from early morning until around 3 p.m. It's an astonishing mix of old and new items. It's vast and there may have been 250,000 people there the Sunday we went. You've just got to keep walking and work your way into areas beyond the vendors set-up at the beginning. You can certainly take a cab to the market, which is located in the Trastevere neighborhood of Rome. You can also get there from the hotel by metro and bus. You can start by either walking along Julius Ceasar Boulevard to Via Lepanto. If you want to take the subway one stop from Ottaviano to Lepanto, you can. It's at Lepanto that you'll catch a bus heading south. It'll take you past St. Peter's and along the Tiber River to Trastevere. The bus will be crowded with flea market visitors. When they get off, you get off. Trust me, you'll know. Or ask questions. Most Romans speak a little English and they are very friendly. An experience that's also free, unless you buy things and there's a lot to buy. That's the Alimandi and my Roma. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel and well worth your consideration.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am an American living in Italy, and I have been to more than a few hotels in Rome. I stayed at the 3-star Hotel Alimandi on Via Tunisi (behind the 4-star Hotel Alimandi across the street from the Vatican Museums) in September 2005. Do not confuse the two, which is easy. The Hotel Alimandi was recommended to me by several people I know. The (3-star) Hotel Alimandi, overall, is an excellent hotel and on my list of "sure bets" when I come to Rome with family from the States. The price, of course, is not the cheapest, but in my opinion one of the most reasonable prices you can pay when you consider several factors. First, it's about 50 meters from the front door of the Vatican Museums and a short walk to the rest of Vatican City. Can't beat the location. Secondly, the staff is excellent and friendly, and for those who don't speak Italian, are able to communicate in great English. The beds were clean, the rooms comfortable though a little sparse. Hey, it's not the Ritz! Lastly, and no less importantly, the breakfast was the largest I've ever seen in a hotel in Italy. No puny little pastry in a plastic bag, but a full complement of European and American buffet. Downsides to this hotel? Believe it or not, location. Being so close to the Vatican puts it at a distance from other landmarks, though still walkable. The Colosseum is perhaps the furthest "must see" if you're new to Rome, and is about a 20-30 minute walk, depending on how many turists are out and about. Those who give this hotel low marks must be very hard to please indeed. No place is perfect, though clearly some are very much better than others. This is one of those places. I have NO hesitation about coming back to this hotel, though I think I'll wait to the low season!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and personal; convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hongkongsue_10
Reviews.Content: At the start of our Rome visit, we stayed in a chain hotel and had booked the Alimandi, a block from the Vatican Museum, for our return after a trip to Florence. Since we only wanted to take one bag on the train, the Alimandi staff graciously stored our extra six bags until we registered. We noticed the well-equipped bar and asked if we could order some coffee which desk clerk, Barbara, prepared for us. She also showed us the rooftop area used for evening relaxation as well as for the buffet breakfast. On the main lobby level are several other well-appointed rooms for guests to enjoy. One had a TV equipped with comfortable softas and a special movie channel. Downstairs was an exercise room and one computer station available for one euro a session. Our room was large and the bed comfortable. Decoration might be a bit dated and the shower a bit unusual being in a small tub with two shower heads, the main one at a low height and the other flexible. Also, we could not find any control to regulate the air-conditioning, but we were out most of the time and at night had enough blankets. The buffet breakfast offered fresh pastries as well as delicious scrambled eggs that had bits of cooked sausage in them. We were able to bring our own pot of coffee to the table and were surprised when the cook brought us complimentary cappucinos. When I wanted to get my hair cut next door, the desk clerk took me there and explained my preferences to the staff. We were also pleased with the airport transport service included in the price. It was efficient and comfortable. We could tell that the Alimandi family takes pride in their hotel and they have added a lot of artistic touches to make it unique. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Fullmoon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alamandi is an excellent, family run hotel - we stayed for 6 nights in July, 2005 - booked it on the internet - the whole experience was flawless, from the pick-up at the airport (part of the service) by Enrico Lombardi - one of the 7 brothers and sisters who run this twin hotel operation literally steps from the Vatican Museum. The room was very large by European standards, modern, spotlessly clean. The breakfast (also part of the price) was delicious - fresh fruit, yogurt, various breads and pastries, cereals, eggs, sausage, bacon, vegetables and coffee to order. The front desk was very helpful and gave excellent directions, advice and restaurant recommendations in both Italian and English. We will return to the Hotel Alamandi the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at Alimandi the night before we left Italy. We selected that hotel for the free shuttle service to the airport, that saved us approximately 50 Euros. All the staff was extremely helpful. The front desk staff provided us with coffee in the morning before the airport shuttle even though breakfast was not yet served.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lula58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi 3-star from May 11-May 15. The staff was helpful and friendly. They were willing to help with dining suggestions. They helped us with bus routes and and called the taxi for us. The room is a little small but was absolutely immaculate. The shower was large and had a litte stool if you wanted to sit. There was a voltage switch so you could use 120V or 230V. The buffet breakfast was yummy. It was served in a rooftop room that had a wonderful view of St. Peter's cathedral. The shuttle from the airport was so handy though a little hard to find where to meet them. The hotel is in a wonderfully quiet residential neighborhood right across the street from the Vatican Museum. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “alimandi is a great value”
Reviews.Author: travelaurPa
Reviews.Content: The Alimandi Roma has clean, spacious (by European standards), well lit rooms and the best shower in Italy! The location is excellent for the Vatican and sistine chapel but a bit far from everything else. However, there is close to access to public transportation and getting around is cheap and easy. The breakfast is a bit unusual. There are MANY items on the buffet including chicken, potatoes, cooked veggies as well as more commonly eaten breakfast items. Most of the cooked food is overcooked and greasy though. Free airport shuttle will save you 40 Euros! All in all, a great stay and even better value! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marysr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alimandi 3 star with 2 girl friends at the end of April. It is the older hotel which is very quaint. The room had a double bed and two singles but was quite small although very clean and comfortable. It was quite noisy of traffic late at night and early in the morning but we did keep the windows open and didn't use the air conditioning. In the summer if the windows are kept shut it would not be so noisy. The bathroom had a very small bath, not big enough to lie down in and the plug in the sink did not fit properly so the water kept draining away. The roof terrace where they serve breakfast was lovely as was the food. If you want somewhere to relax during the day or in the evening the terrace is a great place. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Although there is a free shuttle bus to the airport, be warned that this is not to/from Ciampino but Fiumicino only. I looked at their 4 star hotel across the road and it is very nice and modern with larger rooms and costs an extra 20 euros a night. I was very happy with the 3 star but if you want luxury go with the 4 star. I am going back in August and have booked to stay at 3 star again. An ideal hotel for the Vatican, but queues for the museum very long. Go early or later in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern”
Reviews.Author: Phil6184
Reviews.Content: This is a very good but small hotel. The rooms are modern and very well appointed with every luxury imaginable, including marble everything, flat screen tv, 2 double beds, very good air conditioning. The only thing I could complain about was they seem to be a bit short staffed (although my stay was during an Italian holiday so that may explain the shortage). The breakfast buffet was just ok in my opinion. I really appreciated the free airport shuttle. This is a very generous thing to offer to guests, easily saving us about 80 euro. As noted, the location is perfect. The staff was very helpful. I would especially like to thank Aldo for his kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Highly-recommended modern, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Alimandi could not have been better. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our room was large, modern, clean, and quiet. The location was excellent - across the street from the entrance to the Vatican Museum and a few blocks away from 2 different Metro stops. The breakfast buffet was delicious. We were also very grateful for the free shuttle service to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spotless, beautifully furnished rooms, friendly (day and night), very reasonable prices, fantastically situated (50 yards from vatican museum entrance), easily accessable by bus and metro, 5minute walk from st peters square. Absolutely Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in the summer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time. The AC works wonderfully (unlike many more expensive Rose hotels), keeping our room cool in a hot July. The staff was wonderful and the location was ideal (we could watch the Vatical Museum line forming while enjoying our complimary breakfast). And all for a very reasonable price. We look forward to heading back.

Reviews.Title: “Good - not Great”
Reviews.Author: James-and-Jenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 23rd to 27th Feb 2005 - There have been a lot of great reviews of this hotel - thats why I booked it. The hotel is a good hotel - there is another new Hotel with the same name across the road and I'm not sure if thats where some people might have stayed - on the whole the Hotel is OK - the room was a little bit small - the bed was a little hard the shower was a little low - the staff where helpful - no real complaints - just not the wonderful hotel everyone writes about - one thing go out for a meal at Osteria Dell' Angelo on the Via G.Bettolo about 5 - 10 mins walk from the hotel €25 per head inc wine - be warned the waiters are big rugby players and very friendly - you will have a great meal and a great laugh.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to our European trip”
Reviews.Author: Parker
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three weeks in Europe, from September 21 through October 12. See my other reviews of the La Fortezza in Florence, the Hotel Bernardi in Venice, the Libertel Austerlitz in Paris, and the Ibis Earl's Court in London. The first stop on our European trip was for four days in Rome and the Hotel Alimandi on Via Tunisi. Traveling to a foreign destination can be tense, so one wants the first stop to set the tone. Our first hotel, the Alimandi, elated us. This is a superior hotel run by three brothers (the Alimandis) who care about their clientele. Although the rooms are small (this information is provided for those who care about such things, but it's not a negative), they are immaculate, with superb maid service, clean sheets and fresh towels. The location, on the southern edge of the Prati district, was fabulous. You're within walking distance of the Metro, a vibrant shopping and dining street, and the Vatican and its museum. Across the street from the hotel is a gelato shop (Gelateria Siciliano) that served fantastic treats. We also dined at the Bella Napoli restaurant across from the movie theater a few blocks away from the hotel on the bustling commercial street on a couple of occasions. Good food and pleasing service. The Alimandi serves a breakfast (cooked by Francisco) that is knock-your-socks-off terrific. There are at least 25 choices to eat, from toast, to yogurt, to several different kinds of cereal, to fresh fruits, to ham, to cheeses, to omelets, to fresh vegetables, juices, and world-class coffee. The added bonus of the breakfast is that its served in the hotel's roof-top garden patio with a great view of the Vatican and the tip of St. Peter's dome. The patio is large and open all day and night for quiet moments. You can go up to the roof to have a smoke or sip some wine. The Alimandi also has car service to and from the airport. There are also first-floor library and piano and bar rooms for relaxing The Alimandi is an utterly professional operation. It may not have a lot of bedrooms, but it is run with precision by very friendly people. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. It was our very first visit to Europe. as well as our first stop of a 4 country trip. From the beginning of our stay with the airport shuttle to our last day, this hotel was great. Spotlessly clean, the staff was great and very helpful, breakfast was outstanding. I couldn't believe that we were right next door to the Vatican Museum. We loved the city of Rome, and would most diffently come back and stay at this hotel. In fact we had wished we had done Rome last instead of our first stop, as Rome was the highlight of our trip to Europe. We also loved the restaurant La Rustichella which was one of the restaurants the hotel recommended. Will stay at this hotel and will recommand it to anyone who is going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Bargain for Rome”
Reviews.Author: ridger2222
Reviews.Content: Everything positive in the other reviews is true. Great location for the Vatican and Metro, best breakfast on our entire trip, helpful staff, plus free airport pick up. At 150 euro this was the most expensive hotel we arranged, but it was worth it. There were six people in our group, and all were well pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Warm, Family Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a spectacular trip to Italy. We spent 3 wonderful nights at the Alimandi Hotel, a small, quaint, family-run hotel. Our room was quite comfortable with a/c, a great view & elevator! The staff was warm, very helpful with recommendations on where to eat, sights to see, bus line info, directions, and any other questions novice travelers could ask. They serve a huge buffet-style breakfast on the terrace overlooking St. Peters Basilica. The food was quite good, lots of choices with capuccinos and latte's galore. They are opening a second hotel in July or August, 2004 -- slightly larger. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely stay there again. The entire staff spoke English as did most Italians!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value”
Reviews.Author: deejay21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find, had parking and was right next to the Vatican! The hotel management were very nice, the rooms were clean and well taken care of, even a tooth brush and paste in the bathroom! The breakfast buffet was excellent, in a lovely roof-top terrace area. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The best Italian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bhansenk
Reviews.Content: This hotel's FREE Airport Shuttle was so convenient. The breakfast buffet was the fullest and best I've ever had in Europe! The staff are patient and helpful. The location is so close to the Vatican and so easy to get around Rome from. There are laundry and grocery facilites really close. If you stay in Rome, this place is THE ONE to pick. I'd love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add to the previous review--he was pretty much on the money. We didn't know about the newer place but the older place that we stayed in was great. Convenient to the metro-2 blocks and there is a store just 1 block down for purchasing water, toiletries, etc. The breakfast on the roof was outstanding but you do want to go before 9 am to take full advantage. The beds were comfy and the room was clean. We stayed in a triple room. The A/C was much needed as the temp was 90 or above for the 3 days we were there (June 9-11).

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: cruisewhiz
Reviews.Content: For those seasoned travelers looking for a very good hotel value with a great location in Rome (one block from Vatican Museum) at a reaonable price, the Alimandi fits the bill. We stayed in late May/early June for 3 nights before a cruise and 2 nights afterwards. We found this hotel and staff to be excellent. The rooms are moderate in size with dated furnishings but very clean, quiet and airy. They provided punctual bus service to and from the airport (free) as well as to the port of Civitavecchia (small fee). Friendly service was always available including a free full breakfast on a rooftop terrace. All the front desk persons were very helpful with suggestions, tickets and directions for both nearby subway and bus service for which we took full advantage. Great dining suggestions and a wonderful gelati shop across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi for one night prior to returning to the U.S. The room was very small and claustrophobic though very clean. The bathroom was also very small and the water pressure wasn't great. This is a family run hotel and the family was very friendly and attentive. Breakfast was good and the setting was pretty, up on the roof. The hotel is close to the Vatican and to the Metro. It is in a very busy neighborhood. There was no street noise in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel in May 2004 and were pleased with every aspect of service that the hotel had to offer. Flew in from London and staff picked us up in a minibus free of charge. Hotel rooms were basic, very clean and quiet. Roof-top terrace was great to relax in with a bottle of wine after walking around all day. Hotel is located about a five-minute walk from the Vatican Museum (if you want to tour Vatican City...make a reservation in advance), and other great attractions. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for three days. I was vey impressed with the quality of hotel. The hotel is very well decorated and the rooms are very clean. It is very close to the Vatican Musuem and also very convenient to go to other attractions. I would definately stay at this hotel again.
